alert.note: Alert for Rowan (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 4:22PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following county, Rowan. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 419 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated recent heavy rain due to thunderstorms over eastern Rowan County. Radar and rain gauges indicate 1 to 2 inches of rain over the past hour, and an additional inch is possible through 5 pm. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Salisbury, Spencer, Granite Quarry, Rockwell, Faith and High Rock Lake. Flooding is most likely along tributaries to the Yadkin River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed.
